meanings.definition: Overturned or flipped over, especially in reference to a boat or ship.
meanings.sent1: The capsized boat floated upside down in the water.
meanings.sent2: The sailors were rescued from the capsized ship.
meanings.sent3: The capsized boat looked like a giant turtle on its back.
meanings.sent4: The capsized vessel was a stark reminder of the power of the storm.
meanings.sent5: The image of the capsized boat stayed in my mind for days.

meanings.definition: To turn over or flip over suddenly.
meanings.sent1: The strong waves capsized the small fishing boat.
meanings.sent2: The canoe capsized when the paddlers leaned too far to one side.
meanings.sent3: The capsized kayak left the paddler soaked but laughing.
meanings.sent4: Her world capsized when she received the unexpected news.
meanings.sent5: The sudden gust of wind capsized the umbrella, sending it flying.
